_exec_summary.SummaryText:
THE RANDALL FARMERS COOPERATIVE UNION OF RANDALL,  KANSAS IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS THAT SPECIALIZES IN GRAIN STORAGE AND SALES AS WELL AS FERTILIZER AND OTHER INPUTS USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF GRAIN COMMODITIES.

THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA PLANT CONSIST OF ONE -18,000  AND TWO -11,000 GALLON TANKS WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 175,000 POUNDS WHEN FILLED TO 85% CAPACITY.  THE PLANT IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS.  THE KANSAS DEPT. OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR PLANT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL THEIR REQUEST FOR IMPROVEMENT.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD HAVE A TOXIC GAS RELEASE OF 79,000 POUNDS OF AMMONIA WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF1.89 MILES AFFECTING APPROXIMATELY 150 AREA RESIDENTS.  THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO WOULD HAVE AN 11,908 POUND RELEASE IN APPROXIMATELY 2 MINUTES WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF .83  MILES AFFECTING 100 AREA  RESIDENTS.

OUR EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED ANNUALLY AND RECEIVE SPECIFIC TRAINING IN SAFETY INFORMATION, HAZARDS, MAINTENANCE AND OPERATING PROCEDURES.  EMPLOYEES ALWAYS WEAR THE PROPER GLOVES AND GOGGLES DURING FILLING OPERATIONS.  CLEAN SAFETY WATER IS ALWAYS ON HAND DURING NURSE TANK FILLING OPERATIONS.

WE ARE EXTREMELY PROUD TO REPORT THAT NO ACCIDENTAL AMMONIA RELEASES HAVE OCCURRED AT THIS FACILITY DURING THE LAST FIVE YEARS THAT HAVE CAUSED ANY HUMAN  INJURIES OR RESULTED IN PROPERTY DAMAGE.

OUR EMERGENCY REPONSE PLAN HAS BEEN SHARE WITH THE COUNTY LEPC AND THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT.  THEY HAVE TOURED OUR FACILITY AND ARE AWARE OF THE MANY DANGERS ASSOCIATED WITH ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  WE HAVE 9 OF OUR VOLUNTEER FIRE DEPARTMENT WHICH ACTUALLY WORK AT THE RANDALL COOPEATIVE UNION.  THEY  HAVE AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY.
